intro: Pedicularis tenuicalyx, commonly known as the slender calyx lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often resembling orchids in appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats and has a short flowering period in late spring to early summer. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
